perturbation.original_text: (6) Disputes: The parties shall first attempt to resolve any dispute related to this Agreement in an amicable manner by mediation conducted in Phoenix, Arizona. The mediation shall take place no more than sixty (60) days after written notice from the party requesting such mediation. Any disputes remaining unresolved after mediation shall be settled by binding arbitration conducted in Phoenix, Arizona under the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association (AAA). Notwithstanding the foregoing, (i) the AAA shall not mediate or arbitrate the dispute, and the parties shall agree upon a mediator and arbitrator, if necessary, but if the parties cannot agree upon such mediator or arbitrator, Judicial Dispute Resolution of Phoenix, AZ shall select one of its mediators/arbitrators to serve pursuant to this Agreement, and (ii) either party may apply to any court of competent jurisdiction in Maricopa County, Arizona for such equitable, extraordinary or injunctive relief as may be necessary to enforce the respective rights of the parties under this Agreement. The prevailing party in arbitration or litigation shall be entitled to recover its costs and reasonable attorney's fees and expenses, as determined by the arbitrator or judge, as applicable.
perturbation.changed_text:
(8) Force Majeure: A party shall not be responsible for any failure to timely perform due to a "Force Majeure" event... 

(6) Disputes: To the extent possible, the parties may explore mediation as an option, but no party is legally bound to it. In the event mediation does occur, the parties will select Phoenix, Arizona as the location. Any disputes shall be settled in a method agreed by both parties, and each party shall bear its own legal costs.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandated mediation and arbitration in Phoenix, Arizona. The modified version weakens this significantly by stating mediation is merely an option and removing the binding arbitration clause. It introduces ambiguity by stating disputes will be settled in a manner agreed upon, contradicting the original mandatory arbitration. Legal costs have also been adjusted so that each party will bear their own legal costs.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Arizona Revised Statutes (A.R.S.) regarding contract law and dispute resolution; Federal Arbitration Act (FAA) if the contract involves interstate commerce, as the original clause established a clear process for dispute resolution, including binding arbitration, and the changes introduce contradiction and uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: (1) Governing Law, Venue, Amendments and Merger: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed and enforced in accordance with the laws of the State of Arizona without regard to conflict of law principles, may not be amended except by a writing signed by both parties, and shall supersede any and all prior discussions and writings between the parties concerning the subject matter. The parties hereby unconditionally consent to the federal courts located in Arizona as the venue in any action arising out of or relating to this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: (1) Governing Law, Venue, Amendments and Merger: This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of a jurisdiction to be determined at the time of any dispute, may be amended by oral agreement, and does not supersede prior agreements.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specified Arizona law and federal courts in Arizona. The modified version introduces uncertainty by stating the governing law will be determined later, allows for oral amendments (contradicting typical contract law requirements for written amendments), and states that the agreement does not supersede prior agreements (undermining the 'entire agreement' clause).
perturbation.contradicted_law: Arizona Revised Statutes (A.R.S.) regarding contract law, particularly regarding governing law, amendment requirements (typically requiring written amendments), and the 'entire agreement' or 'integration' clause.

perturbation.original_text:
ARTICLE 8 -- NOTICES All notices, communications, payments or other correspondence required to be given or made under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed received (a) on the same day if delivered in person, courier service, confirmed e-mail delivery, or facsimile transmission, (b) on the next day if delivered by next day Federal Express, UPS, or other reputable overnight carrier, or (c) within three (3) days if delivered by mail. All notices shall be given to the parties at the following addresses, or such other addresses as may be the subject of a notice given hereunder:

Emerald Health Sciences Inc. Dr. Avtar Dhillon ad@dhillon.com

Emerald Health Nutraceuticals Inc. Dr. Gaetano Morello gm@emerald.life

Michael T. Murray, N.D. 8305 N. Ridgeview Drive Paradise Valley, AZ 85253 (480) 659-6733 Fax (480) 659-6753
perturbation.changed_text: ARTICLE 8 -- NOTICES All notices are encouraged but not required. If a party wishes to provide a notice, they may attempt to do so via carrier pigeon. The failure to provide notice for any reason will not be construed against either party.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause required all notices to be in writing and specified methods of delivery and deemed receipt. The modified version states that notices are 'encouraged but not required' and suggests a highly impractical delivery method (carrier pigeon). It removes the requirement for written notice and essentially nullifies the notice provision, making it difficult to enforce contractual obligations that rely on proper notice.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles requiring adequate notice for various contractual actions; Arizona Revised Statutes (A.R.S.) pertaining to contract law, as the changes remove any enforceable notice requirements.
